title: MAG 055 - Pest Control Transcript
text:
nerate her body, I smelled it again. Like before. Took me a 
while to piece the two together, but I thought you should know. 
ARCHIVIST 
Are you saying there might be more out there like her? 
JORDAN 
God, I hope not. I don’t know. The man from the ant house, he wasn’t like her, 
not at all, but that smell when they burned... I think they’re connected, 
somehow. And that scares me. 
ARCHIVIST 
Yes... yes, it rather scares me too. 
[Tape clicks off.] 
ARCHIVIST 
Mr Kennedy’s statement has left me somewhat rattled. While I am always glad 
of any further closure to the case of Jane Prentiss, this seems to come with the 
rather serious caveat that she might not have been working alone. No, that 

The Magnus Archives – Episode 055 – Pest Control 
 
17 
 
doesn’t sound right. Jane Prentiss, or whatever this ‘flesh hive’ was that took 
her, does not seem like the sort of being that would work well with others. 
The house in Bromley was torn down last year, but Martin managed to locate 
the ownership records. It was listed as belonging to John Amherst. The dates 
aren’t entirely clear as to whether this was just before or just after he 
apparently took charge of Ivy Meadows nursing home, but there can be no 
doubt that it was the same person. All the ownership records from the ant 
house lead to dead ends or deactivated bank accounts. It doesn’t sound like 
he’s another flesh hive and yet... no connection except disease and insects. 
And a foul smell when they burn. 
Jane Prentiss is dead, but this is a long way from over. 
End recording. 
[Tape clicks off. Tape clicks on.] 
ARCHIVIST 
Supplemental. I... I don’t have much to report actually. It’s been Halloween 
week, which means the research department is always inundated with 
statements. Most of them are patently false, but the volume means that 
they’ve called in the Archive to assist with the overflow. 

The Magnus Archives – Episode 055 – Pest Control 
 
18 
 
It’s been nice, actually. Disproving piles of nonsense felt good, like real work, 
not just driving myself to distraction with conspiracy theories and paranoia. I 
even got a good night’s sleep. I miss those days. End supplemental. 
[Tape clicks off.]

licence. 
Today’s episode was written by Jonathan Sims and directed by Alexander J 
Newall. 
It featured: Jonathan Sims as The Archivist and Tim Ledsam as Jordan Kennedy.
